messages.messageBody:
Thank you Pam. This guy will want page numbers. Can you help?
cris (not feeling *too* unsure...!!)

<pamsoroosh@m...> wrote:
> Teach Your Own
>
> -pam
>
>

>

> >

this

> > children's growth into the world is not that it is a better school
> > than the schools, but that it isn't a school at all. << John Holt
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] john holt quote
messages.messageBody:
Teach Your Own

-pam

messages.subject: john holt quote
messages.msgSnippet: Would anyone happen to know which book or other piece of writing this quote comes from? ... children s growth into the world is not that it is a better school
messages.messageBody:
Would anyone happen to know which book or other piece of writing this
quote comes from?

>>What is most important and valuable about the home as a base for
children's growth into the world is not that it is a better school
than the schools, but that it isn't a school at all. << John Holt


I am using it in a "discussion" on a local list and would like to be
able to cite the context.

If anyone knows, you guys will. <G>

cris
